answers.text:
Attached is an example of survey results for community centers in part New York. The questions asked are clearly bolded so you will be able to see what was asked of the participants as well as their answers and an indepth analysis of the entire survey's results.  
The entire survey was conducted, compiled and analyzed by a private firm call Urbanomics Inc. It may be an option for your city of you like the example.  
Hope it helps!

Hi Kimberly,
The ICMA Center for Performance Measurement actually partners with the National Research Center's National Citizen Survey, which, among other things, helps you reach out to your citizens and garner useful feedback on your Parks and Recreation programs and facilities.  Conveniently, the National Research Center shares data with CPM, so those jurisdictions that are members of both programs have the added benefit of seeing their NCS data in our CPM Annual Data Report as well, making comparison with other jurisdictions much easier.  If you have any questions about either program, feel free to call me at (202) 962-3652.  Good luck!

author: Kimberly King
text: Our Parks Department is in the process of evaluating a number of our community centers to determine if they are meeting the needs of the neighborhoods they serve.  We are looking for examples of surveys that would help us perform this evaluation resulting in recommendations regarding the continuation, elimination or addition of services at each center.
title: Community Center Needs Assessment Survey
